intro: Parestia elata, commonly known as the slender parestia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
